glsa.title: Echoping: Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Echoping might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: Echoping is a small program to test performances of a remote host by sending it TCP packets.

description.p: A boundary error exists within the “TLS_readline()” function, which can be exploited to overflow a global buffer by sending an overly long encrypted HTTP reply to Echoping. Also, a similar boundary error exists within the “SSL_readline()” function, which can be exploited in the same manner.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted HTTP reply, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
